page.title: 15Chislehurst-local history.
page.content: In the summer we change our time to British summer time.This is part of our local history.A man called William Willlet thought of the idea and started to campaign for daylight saving in 1907.Parliament adopted his idea in 1916 as a wartime economy.William Willet died in 1915 at the age of 59.He was buried in St.Nicholas church graveyard. Not far from the church is the cockpit.The cockpit was used for cock-fighting.It is a big hollow dip in the ground and is still in perfect condition.After cock-fighting was banned in 1834,the cockpit was used for other activities during the annual fair.Both the cockpit and the church are on the common.Most of the common is owned by the National Trust.
